t: Lamentations 1
How Lonely Sits the City

How*pn lonely sits the city that*ld was full of people! How*ln like a widow has she become, she*ld who was great among the nations! She*ln who was a princess among the provinces has*ld become a slave.

She*pn weeps bitterly in the night, with*ld tears on her cheeks; among*ln all her lovers she*ld has none to comfort her; all*ln her friends have dealt treacherously with her; they*ld have become her enemies.

Judah*pn has gone into exile because of affliction and*ld hard servitude; she*ln dwells now among the nations, but*ld finds no resting place; her*ln pursuers have all overtaken her in*ld the midst of her distress.
The*pn roads to Zion mourn, for*ld none come to the festival; all*ln her gates are desolate; her*ld priests groan; her*ln virgins have been afflicted, and*ld she herself suffers bitterly.

Her*pn foes have become the head; her*ld enemies prosper, because*ln the Lord*s has afflicted her for*ld the multitude of her transgressions; her*ln children have gone away, captives*ld before the foe.
From*pn the daughter of Zion all*ld her majesty has departed. Her*ln princes have become like deer that*ld find no pasture; they*ln fled without strength before*ld the pursuer.

Jerusalem*pn remembers in*ld the days of her affliction and wandering all*ln the precious things that*ld were hers from days of old. When*ln her people fell into the hand of the foe, and*ld there was none to help her, her*ln foes gloated over her; they*ld mocked at her downfall.
Jerusalem*pn sinned grievously; therefore*ld she became filthy; all*ln who honored her despise her, for*ld they have seen her nakedness; she*ln herself groans and*ld turns her face away.

Her*pn uncleanness was in her skirts; she*ld took no thought of her future; therefore*ln her fall is terrible; she*ld has no comforter. “O*ln Lord,*s behold my affliction, for*ld the enemy has triumphed!”
The*pn enemy has stretched out his hands over*ld all her precious things; for*ln she has seen the nations enter*ld her sanctuary, those*ln whom you forbade to*ld enter your congregation.
All*pn her people groan as*ld they search for bread; they*ln trade their treasures for food to*ld revive their strength. “Look,*ln O Lord,*s and see, for*ld I am despised.”
“Is*pn it nothing to you, all you who pass by? Look*ld and see if*ln there is any sorrow like my sorrow, which*ld was brought upon me, which*ln the Lord*s inflicted on*ld the day of his fierce anger.
“From*pn on high he sent fire; into*ld my bones he made it descend; he*ln spread a net for my feet; he*ld turned me back; he*ln has left me stunned, faint*ld all the day long.

“My*pn transgressions were bound into a yoke; by*ld his hand they were fastened together; they*ln were set upon my neck; he*ld caused my strength to fail; the*ln Lord gave me into the hands of*ld those whom I cannot withstand.
“The*pn Lord rejected all*ld my mighty men in my midst; he*ln summoned an assembly against me to*ld crush my young men; the*ln Lord has trodden as in a winepress the*ld virgin daughter of Judah.
“For*pn these things I weep; my*ld eyes flow with tears; for*ln a comforter is far from me, one*ld to revive my spirit; my*ln children are desolate, for*ld the enemy has prevailed.”

Zion*pn stretches out her hands, but*ld there is none to comfort her; the*ln Lord*s has commanded against Jacob that*ld his neighbors should be his foes; Jerusalem*ln has become a*ld filthy thing among them.
“The*pn Lord*s is in the right, for*ld I have rebelled against his word; but*ln hear, all you peoples, and*ld see my suffering; my*ln young women and my young men have*ld gone into captivity.
“I*pn called to my lovers, but*ld they deceived me; my*ln priests and elders perished*ld in the city, while*ln they sought food to*ld revive their strength.

“Look,*pn O Lord,*s for I am in distress; my*ld stomach churns; my*ln heart is wrung within me, because*ld I have been very rebellious. In*ln the street the sword bereaves; in*ld the house it is like death.

“They*pn heard my groaning, yet*ld there is no one to comfort me. All*ln my enemies have heard of my trouble; they*ld are glad that you have done it. You*ln have brought the day you announced; now*ld let them be as I am.
“Let*pn all their evildoing come before you, and*ld deal with them as*ln you have dealt with me because*ld of all my transgressions; for*ln my groans are many, and*ld my heart is faint.”
Lamentations 2
The Lord Has Destroyed Without Pity

How*pn the Lord in his anger has*ld set the daughter of Zion under a cloud! He*ln has cast down from heaven to earth the*ld splendor of Israel; he*ln has not remembered his footstool in*ld the day of his anger.

The*pn Lord has swallowed up without mercy all*ld the habitations of Jacob; in*ln his wrath he has broken down the*ld strongholds of the daughter of Judah; he*ln has brought down to the ground in dishonor the*ld kingdom and its rulers.

He*pn has cut down in fierce anger all*ld the might of Israel; he*ln has withdrawn from them his right hand in*ld the face of the enemy; he*ln has burned like a flaming fire in Jacob, consuming*ld all around.

He*pn has bent his bow like an enemy, with*ld his right hand set like a foe; and*ln he has killed all who were delightful in our eyes in*ld the tent of the daughter of Zion; he*ln has poured out his fury like fire.

The*pn Lord has become like an enemy; he*ld has swallowed up Israel; he*ln has swallowed up all its palaces; he*ld has laid in ruins its strongholds, and*ln he has multiplied in the daughter of Judah mourning*ld and lamentation.

He*pn has laid waste his booth like a garden, laid*ld in ruins his meeting place; the*ln Lord*s has made Zion forget festival*ld and Sabbath, and*ln in his fierce indignation has spurned king and priest.

The*pn Lord has scorned his altar, disowned*ld his sanctuary; he*ln has delivered into the hand of the enemy the*ld walls of her palaces; they*ln raised a clamor in the house of the Lord*s as*ld on the day of festival.

The*pn Lord*s determined to lay in ruins the*ld wall of the daughter of Zion; he*ln stretched out the measuring line; he*ld did not restrain his hand from destroying; he*ln caused rampart and wall to lament; they*ld languished together.

Her*pn gates have sunk into the ground; he*ld has ruined and broken her bars; her*ln king and princes are among the nations; the*ld law is no more, and*ln her prophets find no*ld vision from the Lord.*s

The*pn elders of the daughter of Zion sit*ld on the ground in silence; they*ln have thrown dust on their heads and*ld put on sackcloth; the*ln young women of Jerusalem have*ld bowed their heads to the ground.

My*pn eyes are spent with weeping; my*ld stomach churns; my*ln bile is poured out to the ground because*ld of the destruction of the daughter of my people, because*ln infants and babies faint in*ld the streets of the city.
They*pn cry to their mothers, “Where*ld is bread and wine?” as*ln they faint like a wounded man in*ld the streets of the city, as*ln their life is poured out on*ld their mothers’ bosom.

What*pn can I say for you, to what compare you, O*ld daughter of Jerusalem? What*ln can I liken to you, that I may comfort you, O*ld virgin daughter of Zion? For*ln your ruin is vast as the sea; who*ld can heal you?

Your*pn prophets have seen for you false*ld and deceptive visions; they*ln have not exposed your iniquity to*ld restore your fortunes, but*ln have seen for you oracles that*ld are false and misleading.

All*pn who pass along the way clap*ld their hands at you; they*ln hiss and wag their heads at*ld the daughter of Jerusalem: “Is*ln this the city that was called the*ld perfection of beauty, the*ld joy of all the earth?”
All*pn your enemies rail*ld against you; they*ln hiss, they gnash their teeth, they*ld cry: “We have swallowed her! Ah,*ln this is the day we longed for; now*ld we have it; we see it!”

The*pn Lord*s has done what he purposed; he*ld has carried out his word, which*ln he commanded long ago; he*ld has thrown down without pity; he*ln has made the enemy rejoice over you and*ld exalted the might of your foes.
Their*pn heart cried to the Lord. O*ld wall of the daughter of Zion, let*ln tears stream down like a torrent day*ld and night! Give*ln yourself no rest, your*ld eyes no respite!

“Arise,*pn cry out in the night, at*ld the beginning of the night watches! Pour*ln out your heart like water before*ld the presence of the Lord! Lift*ln your hands to him for*ld the lives of your children, who*ln faint for hunger at*ld the head of every street.”

Look,*pn O Lord,*s and see! With*ld whom have you dealt thus? Should*ln women eat the fruit of their womb, the*ld children of their tender care? Should*ln priest and prophet be killed in*ld the sanctuary of the Lord?

In*pn the dust of the streets lie*ld the young and the old; my*ln young women and my young men have*ld fallen by the sword; you*ln have killed them in the day of your anger, slaughtering*ld without pity.
You*pn summoned as if to a festival day my*ld terrors on every side, and*ln on the day of the anger of the Lord*s no*ld one escaped or survived; those*ln whom I held and raised my*ld enemy destroyed.
Lamentations 3
Great Is Your Faithfulness
I*pn am the man who has seen affliction under*ld the rod of his wrath;
he*ln has driven and brought me into*ld darkness without any light;
surely*ln against me he turns his hand again*ld and again the whole day long.
He*pn has made my flesh and my skin waste away; he*ld has broken my bones;
he*ln has besieged and enveloped me with*ld bitterness and tribulation;
he*ln has made me dwell in darkness like*ld the dead of long ago.
He*pn has walled me about so that I cannot escape; he*ld has made my chains heavy;
though*ln I call and cry for help, he*ld shuts out my prayer;
he*ln has blocked my ways with blocks of stones; he*ld has made my paths crooked.
He*pn is a bear lying in wait for me, a*ld lion in hiding;
he*ln turned aside my steps and tore me to pieces; he*ld has made me desolate;
he*ln bent his bow and set me as*ld a target for his arrow.
He*pn drove into my kidneys the*ld arrows of his quiver;
I*ln have become the laughingstock of all peoples, the*ld object of their taunts all day long.
He*ln has filled me with bitterness; he*ld has sated me with wormwood.
He*pn has made my teeth grind on gravel, and*ld made me cower in ashes;
my*ln soul is bereft of peace; I*ld have forgotten what happiness is;
so*ln I say, “My endurance has perished; so*ld has my hope from the Lord.”*s
Remember*pn my affliction and my wanderings, the*ld wormwood and the gall!
My*ln soul continually remembers it and*ld is bowed down within me.
But*ln this I call to mind, and*ld therefore I have hope:
The*pn steadfast love of the Lord*s never ceases; his*ld mercies never come to an end;
they*ln are new every morning; great*ld is your faithfulness.
“The*ln Lord*s is my portion,” says my soul, “therefore*ld I will hope in him.”
The*pn Lord*s is good to those who wait for him, to*ld the soul who seeks him.
It*ln is good that one should wait quietly for*ld the salvation of the Lord.*s
It*ln is good for a man that he bear the*ld yoke in his youth.
Let*pn him sit alone in silence when*ld it is laid on him;
let*ln him put his mouth in the dust— there*ld may yet be hope;
let*ln him give his cheek to the one who strikes, and*ld let him be filled with insults.
For*pn the Lord will not cast*ld off forever,
but,*ln though he cause grief, he will have compassion according*ld to the abundance of his steadfast love;
for*ln he does not afflict from his heart or*ld grieve the children of men.
To*pn crush underfoot all*ld the prisoners of the earth,
to*ln deny a man justice in*ld the presence of the Most High,
to*ln subvert a man in his lawsuit, the*ld Lord does not approve.
Who*pn has spoken and it came to pass, unless*ld the Lord has commanded it?
Is*ln it not from the mouth of the Most High that*ld good and bad come?
Why*ln should a living man complain, a*ld man, about the punishment of his sins?
Let*pn us test and examine our ways, and*ld return to the Lord!*s
Let*ln us lift up our hearts and hands to*ld God in heaven:
“We*ln have transgressed and rebelled, and*ld you have not forgiven.
“You*pn have wrapped yourself with anger and pursued us, killing*ld without pity;
you*ln have wrapped yourself with a cloud so*ld that no prayer can pass through.
You*ln have made us scum and garbage among*ld the peoples.
“All*pn our enemies open*ld their mouths against us;
panic*ln and pitfall have come upon us, devastation*ld and destruction;
my*ln eyes flow with rivers of tears because*ld of the destruction of the daughter of my people.
“My*pn eyes will flow without ceasing, without*ld respite,
until*ln the Lord*s from heaven looks*ld down and sees;
my*ln eyes cause me grief at*ld the fate of all the daughters of my city.
“I*pn have been hunted like a bird by*ld those who were my enemies without cause;
they*ln flung me alive into the pit and*ld cast stones on me;
water*ln closed over my head; I*ld said, ‘I am lost.’
“I*pn called on your name, O Lord,*s from*ld the depths of the pit;
you*ln heard my plea, ‘Do not close your*ld ear to my cry for help!’
You*ln came near when I called on you; you*ld said, ‘Do not fear!’
“You*pn have taken up my cause, O Lord; you*ld have redeemed my life.
You*ln have seen the wrong done to me, O Lord;*s judge*ld my cause.
You*ln have seen all their vengeance, all*ld their plots against me.
“You*pn have heard their taunts, O Lord,*s all*ld their plots against me.
The*ln lips and thoughts of my assailants are*ld against me all the day long.
Behold*ln their sitting and their rising; I*ld am the object of their taunts.
“You*pn will repay them, O Lord,*s according*ld to the work of their hands.
You*ln will give them dullness of heart; your*ld curse will be on them.
You*ln will pursue them in anger and destroy them from*ld under your heavens, O Lord.”*s
Lamentations 4
The Holy Stones Lie Scattered
How*pn the gold has grown dim, how*ld the pure gold is changed! The*ln holy stones lie scattered at*ld the head of every street.
The*pn precious sons of Zion, worth*ld their weight in fine gold, how*ln they are regarded as earthen pots, the*ld work of a potter’s hands!
Even*pn jackals offer the breast; they*ld nurse their young; but*ln the daughter of my people has become cruel, like*ld the ostriches in the wilderness.
The*pn tongue of the nursing infant sticks to*ld the roof of its mouth for thirst; the*ln children beg for food, but*ld no one gives to them.
Those*pn who once feasted on delicacies perish*ld in the streets; those*ln who were brought up in purple embrace*ld ash heaps.
For*pn the chastisement of the daughter of my people has been greater than*ld the punishment of Sodom, which*ln was overthrown in a moment, and*ld no hands were wrung for her.
Her*pn princes were purer than snow, whiter*ld than milk; their*ln bodies were more ruddy than coral, the*ld beauty of their form was like sapphire.
Now*pn their face is blacker than soot; they*ld are not recognized in the streets; their*ln skin has shriveled on their bones; it*ld has become as dry as wood.
Happier*pn were the victims of the sword than*ld the victims of hunger, who*ln wasted away, pierced by*ld lack of the fruits of the field.
The*pn hands of compassionate women have*ld boiled their own children; they*ln became their food during*ld the destruction of the daughter of my people.
The*pn Lord*s gave full vent to his wrath; he*ld poured out his hot anger, and*ln he kindled a fire in Zion that*ld consumed its foundations.
The*pn kings of the earth did not believe, nor*ld any of the inhabitants of the world, that*ln foe or enemy could enter the*ld gates of Jerusalem.
This*pn was for the sins of her prophets and*ld the iniquities of her priests, who*ln shed in the midst of her the*ld blood of the righteous.
They*pn wandered, blind, through the streets; they*ld were so defiled with blood that*ln no one was able to touch their*ld garments.
“Away!*pn Unclean!” people cried at them. “Away!*ld Away! Do not touch!” So*ln they became fugitives and wanderers; people*ld said among the nations, “They*ld shall stay with us no longer.”
The*pn Lord*s himself has scattered them; he*ld will regard them no more; no*ln honor was shown to the priests, no*ld favor to the elders.
Our*pn eyes failed, ever watching vainly*ld for help; in*ln our watching we watched for*ld a nation which could not save.
They*pn dogged our steps so*ld that we could not walk in our streets; our*ln end drew near; our days were numbered, for*ld our end had come.
Our*pn pursuers were swifter than*ld the eagles in the heavens; they*ln chased us on the mountains; they*ld lay in wait for us in the wilderness.
The*pn breath of our nostrils, the Lord’s*s anointed, was*ld captured in their pits, of*ln whom we said, “Under his shadow we*ld shall live among the nations.”
Rejoice*pn and be glad, O daughter of Edom, you*ld who dwell in the land of Uz; but*ln to you also the cup shall pass; you*ld shall become drunk and strip yourself bare.

The*pn punishment of your iniquity, O daughter of Zion, is accomplished; he*ld will keep you in exile no longer; but*ln your iniquity, O daughter of Edom, he will punish; he*ld will uncover your sins.
Lamentations 5
Restore Us to Yourself, O Lord
Remember,*pn O Lord,*s what has befallen us; look,*ld and see our disgrace!
Our*ln inheritance has been turned over to strangers, our*ld homes to foreigners.
We*ln have become orphans, fatherless; our*ld mothers are like widows.
We*ln must pay for the water we drink; the*ld wood we get must be bought.
Our*ln pursuers are at our necks; we*ld are weary; we are given no rest.
We*ln have given the hand to Egypt, and to Assyria, to*ld get bread enough.
Our*ln fathers sinned, and are no more; and*ld we bear their iniquities.
Slaves*ln rule over us; there*ld is none to deliver us from their hand.
We*ln get our bread at the peril of our lives, because*ld of the sword in the wilderness.
Our*ln skin is hot as an oven with*ld the burning heat of famine.
Women*ln are raped in Zion, young*ld women in the towns of Judah.
Princes*ln are hung up by their hands; no*ld respect is shown to the elders.
Young*ln men are compelled to grind at the mill, and*ld boys stagger under loads of wood.
The*ln old men have left the city gate, the*ld young men their music.
The*ln joy of our hearts has ceased; our*ld dancing has been turned to mourning.
The*ln crown has fallen from our head; woe*ld to us, for we have sinned!
For*ln this our heart has become sick, for*ld these things our eyes have grown dim,
for*ln Mount Zion which lies desolate; jackals*ld prowl over it.
But*ln you, O Lord,*s reign forever; your*ld throne endures to all generations.
Why*ln do you forget us forever, why*ld do you forsake us for so many days?
Restore*ln us to yourself, O Lord,*s that we may be restored! Renew*ld our days as of old—
unless*ln you have utterly rejected us, and*ld you remain exceedingly angry with us.
